titleStmt.title: Anno. IIII. Henrici octaui. These be the statutes established in diuerse Parliamentes for the mistery of ye pewterers of London and concerninge the searche of pewter, brasse, and vntrue beames [and] weightes, [and] for deceiuable hawkers, with diverse other orders [and] redresses to be had in the saide mystery, with the renewinge [and?] confirminge of the same statutes.
Public General Acts. Selections: Pewterers.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.

titleStmt.title: Anno. IIII. Henrici octaui. These be the statutes established in diuerse Parliamentes for the mistery of ye pewterers of London and concerninge the searche of pewter, brasse, and vntrue beames [and] weightes, [and] for deceiuable hawkers, with diverse other orders [and] redresses to be had in the saide mystery, with the renewinge [and?] confirminge of the same statutes.
Public General Acts. Selections: Pewterers.

Elyot, Thomas, Maister.

notesStmt.note: Signed: Thomas Elyot. Maister. Thomas Nogey. Thomas Hawke. Wardens.
Running title reads: Anno quarto Henrici octaui.
Imperfect; title page stained; the bracketed "and" inferred.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.

orgName.name: Worshipful Company of Pewterers of London.
